member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AALException
member.summary: The exception type thown when an error occurs during token acquisition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AALException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AALException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AALException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code and error message.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AALException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified. It may especially contain the actual error message returned by the service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AALException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with a specified error code, error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified. It may especially contain the actual error message returned by the service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AALException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the exception class with serialized data.
member.param: The System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AALException.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Sets the System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo with information about the exception.
member.param: The System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

member.summary: The error code returned by the service or generated by client. This is the code you can rely on for exception handling.

member.summary: Abstract base class for all Credential types

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.Credential.#ctor
member.summary: Default contructor.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext
member.summary: The main class representing the authority issuing tokens for resources.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor to create the context with the address of the authority. Using this constructor will turn ON validation of the authority URL by default if validation is supported for the authority address.
member.param: Address of the authority to issue token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor to create the context with the address of the authority and flag to turn address validation off. Using this constructor, address validation can be turned off. Make sure you are aware of the security implication of not validating the address.
member.param: Address of the authority to issue token.
Flag to turn address validation ON or OFF.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext.EndBrowserDialogSession
member.summary: Ends browser dialog session, so user is asked for credentials on the next call to acquire token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext.AcquireToken(System.String,Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.Credential)
member.summary: Acquires security token from the authority.
member.param: Identifier of the target resource that is the recipient of the requested token.
The credential to use for token acquisition. It can of any subclass type of the Credential class, even though depending on the authority type, some credential types may not be supported.
member.returns: It contains Access Token and the Access Token's expiration time. Refresh Token property will be null for this overload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext.AcquireToken(System.String)
member.summary: Acquires security token from the authority.
member.param: Identifier of the target resource that is the recipient of the requested token.
member.returns: It contains Access Token and the Access Token's expiration time. Refresh Token property will be null for this overload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext.AcquireToken(Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.IdentityProviderDescriptor)
member.summary: Acquires security token from the authority.
member.param: The identity provider to federate with.
member.returns: It contains Access Token and the Access Token's expiration time. Refresh Token property will be null for this overload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext.GetProviders(System.String)
member.summary: Gets list of identity providers from the service metadata endpoint
member.param: Identifier of the target resource to get identity providers for.
member.returns: List of identity providers and their supported protocols.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext.AcquireToken(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Acquires security token from the authority.
member.param: Identifier of the target resource that is the recipient of the requested token.
Identifier of the client requesting the token.
Address to return to upon receiving a response from the authority.
member.returns: It contains Access Token, Refresh Token and the Access Token's expiration time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext.AcquireToken(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Acquires security token from the authority.
member.param: Identifier of the target resource that is the recipient of the requested token.
Identifier of the client requesting the token.
Address to return to upon receiving a response from the authority.

This parameter will be used to pre-populate the username field in the authentication form. Please note that the end user can still edit the username field and authenticate as a different user. This parameter can be null.
This parameter will be appended as is to the querystring in the HTTP autentication request to the authority. The parameter can be null.
member.returns: It contains Access Token, Refresh Token and the Access Token's expiration time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext.AcquireToken(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.ClientCredential)
member.summary: Acquires security token from the authority.
member.param: The authorization code received from service authorization endpoint.
Address to return to upon receiving a response from the authority.
The credential to use for token acquisition.
member.returns: It contains Access Token, Refresh Token and the Access Token's expiration time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext.AcquireTokenByRefreshToken(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Acquires a security token from the authority using a Refresh Token previously received.
member.param: Refresh Token to use in the refresh flow.
Name or ID of the client requesting the token.
member.returns: It contains Access Token, Refresh Token and the Access Token's expiration time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationContext.OwnerWindow
member.summary: Owner of the browser dialog which pops up for receiving user credentials. It can be null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationResult
member.summary: Contains the results of one token acquisition operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationResult.CreateAuthorizationHeader
member.summary: Creates authorization header from authentication result.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationResult.AccessTokenType
member.summary: The Access Token requested.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationResult.AccessToken
member.summary: The Access Token requested.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationResult.RefreshToken
member.summary: The Refresh Token associated with the requested Access Token. Note: not all operations will return a Refresh Token.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory.Authentication.AuthenticationResult.ExpiresOn
member.summary: The point in time in which the Access Token returned in the AccessToken property ceases to be valid.
